list.bullet: The ~date()~ / ~gmdate()~ and ~strftime()~ functions can also accepts a Date object instead of a timestamp
The ~getdate()~ function also accepts a Date object as first parameter
The ~Date::mktime()~ and ~Date::gmmktime()~ functions return a Date object
The ~localtime()~ function also accepts a Date object as first parameter
~Date::time()~ returns a Date object representing the current time
All other date related functions are aliased into the Date class as static methods
